Message.Issue: Initialize all static fields in 'FoodRelated' when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.
Change 'FoodRelated.CombinedFoodList' to be read-only by removing the property setter.
Consider a design where 'FoodRelated.CombinedFoodList' doesn't nest generic type 'IList<Tuple<string, float, float, string>>'.

Change 'PopupHandler.ErrorMessageBox(string, Control, int, bool)' to call the MessageBox.Show overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions, and make sure to set MessageBoxOptions.RightAlign and MessageBoxOptions.RtlReading if RightToLeft is set to RightToLeft.Yes on the parent control.

'Storage.ReadRegistry(string, string)' passes 'StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase' as the 'StringComparison' parameter to 'UniversalHandlersLibrary.Contains(this string, string, StringComparison)'. To perform a non-linguistic comparison, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal' or 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase' instead.

'Validation.AlreadyExists(string)' passes 'StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase' as the 'StringComparison' parameter to 'string.Equals(string, StringComparison)'. To perform a non-linguistic comparison, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal' or 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase' instead.

Rule.Name: Collection properties should be read only
Rule.Description: Properties that return collections should be read-only so that users cannot entirely replace the backing store. Users can still modify the contents of the collection by calling relevant methods on the collection. Note that the XmlSerializer class has special support for deserializing read-only collections. See the XmlSerializer overview for more information.
Rule.Resolution: Change {0} to be read-only by removing the property setter.

Rule.Name: Do not nest generic types in member signatures
Rule.Description: Avoid API that require users to instantiate a generic type with another generic type as type argument. The syntax gets too complex.
Rule.Resolution: Consider a design where {0} doesn't nest generic type {1}.

Rule.Name: Initialize reference type static fields inline
Rule.Description: Static fields should be initialized when declared. Initializing static data in explicit static constructors results in less performant code.
Rule.Resolution: Initialize all static fields in {0} when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.

Rule.Name: Specify MessageBoxOptions
Rule.Description: In order to run correctly on right-to-left systems, all calls to MessageBox.Show should use the overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions as an argument. Programs should detect whether they are running on a right-to-left system at run-time and pass the appropriate MessageBoxOptions value in order to display correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Change {0} to call the MessageBox.Show overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions, and make sure to set MessageBoxOptions.RightAlign and MessageBoxOptions.RtlReading if RightToLeft is set to RightToLeft.Yes on the parent control.

Rule.Name: Use ordinal StringComparison
Rule.Description: For non-linguistic comparisons, StringComparison.Ordinal or StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase should be used instead of the linguistically-sensitive StringComparison.InvariantCulture.
Rule.Resolution: {0} passes '{1}' as the 'StringComparison' parameter to {2}. To perform a non-linguistic comparison, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal' or 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase' instead.
